You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.
You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
When you jump, the distance you can cover is tripled.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
You can breathe normally underwater.
You become acclimatized to extreme cold or heat.
Your {@sense darkvision} range increases by 60 feet.
You gain the Spider Climb monster trait.
You gain the Slippery monster trait.
You gain the Chamaeleon Skin monster trait.

entries: Additionally, choose one of the skills gained through your Changeling Instincts racial feature. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with it.

items: You learn an additional Blood Curse and you gain an additional use of Blood Maledict.
When you roll your Hemocraft Die to determine the necrotic damage you take for using a feature from this class, you can roll it a second time and take the lower result.
You gain an additional evolution feat.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, your Eidolon can use its reaction to cause you to drop to 1 hit point instead.
When your Eidolon is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to cause it to drop to 1 hit point instead.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Choose either WIS, INT, or CHA. Your chosen ability score increases by 1 and your maximum for it increases by 2.
Additionally, you learn one skill that uses your chosen ability score.
Your studies of magic have made you particularly adept at creating scrolls and magical items.
You gain proficiency with the enchanter's supplies. If you are already proficient in these tools, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any skill check you make with them.
If you craft a magical item that has a rarity of common or uncommon, it takes you a quarter of the normal time, and it costs you half as much of the usual gold.
You gain access to the mastery of any armor and weapon you are proficient in, as per the {@classFeature Martial Mastery|Barbarian|Ishiir|4|Ishiir} class feature.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Propulsion Armor
entries: The wearer of this armor gains these benefits:

items: The wearer's walking speed increases by 5 feet.

The armor includes gauntlets, each of which is a magic melee weapon that can be wielded only when the hand is holding nothing. The wearer is proficient with the gauntlets, and each one deals {@damage 1d8} force damage on a hit and has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When thrown, the gauntlet detaches and flies at the attack's target, then immediately returns to the wearer and reattaches.
The armor can't be removed against the wearer's will.
If the wearer is missing any limbs, the armor replaces those limbs—hands, arms, feet, legs, or similar appendages. The replacements function identically to the body parts they replace.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Magical Strength
entries: This armor has 6 charges. The wearer can expend the armor's charges in the following ways:

items: When the wearer makes a Strength check or a Strength saving throw, it can expend 1 charge to add a bonus to the roll equal to its Intelligence modifier.
If the creature would be knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}, it can use its reaction to expend 1 charge to avoid being knocked prone.

entries: The armor regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Boots of the Winding Path
entries: While wearing these boots, a creature can teleport up to 15 feet as a bonus action to an unoccupied space the creature can see. The creature must have occupied that space at some point during the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Arcane Focus

item: A rod, staff, or wand (requires attunement)

entries: While holding this item, a creature gains a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, the creature ignores half cover when making a spell attack.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Defense

item: A suit of armor or a shield

entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) the infused item.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Awareness
entries: While wearing this helmet, a creature has advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the wearer can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Homunculus Servant

item: A gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp

entries: You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special {@creature Homunculus Servant|TCE|homunculus} that serves you. The item you infuse serves as the creature's heart, around which the creature's body instantly forms.
You determine the homunculus's appearance. Some artificers prefer mechanical-looking birds, whereas some like winged vials or miniature, animate cauldrons.

The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Homunculus Servant stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge|Ishiir} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, the homunculus can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge|Ishiir}.
The homunculus regains {@dice 2d6} hit points if the {@spell mending|Ishiir} spell is cast on it. If you or the homunculus dies, it vanishes, leaving its heart in its space.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Sharpener

item: A suit of armor or robes

entries: The infused item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, the wearer can use its reaction to expend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, the wielder can take a bonus action to cause it to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action.

The weapon has 4 charges. As a reaction immediately after being hit by an attack, the wielder can expend 1 charge and cause the attacker to be {@condition blinded|Ishiir} until the end of the attacker's next turn, unless the attacker succeeds on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot

item: A simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading property if it has it.

If the weapon lacks ammunition, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when the wielder makes a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic item. You can learn this infusion multiple times; each time you do so, choose a magic item that you can make with it, picking from the Replicable Items tables below. A table's title tells you the level you must be in the class to choose an item from the table. Alternatively, you can choose the magic item from among the {@filter common magic items|items|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common} in the game, not including potions or scrolls.

In the tables, an item's entry tells you whether the item requires attunement. See the item's description in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG} for more information about it, including the type of object required for its making.

entries.caption: Replicable Items (14th-Level Artificer)
rows: {@item Belt of Hill Giant Strength||Belt of hill giant strength}

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Shield
entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wielding this shield.

The shield has 4 charges. While holding it, the wielder can use a reaction immediately after being hit by a melee attack to expend 1 of the shield's charges and push the attacker up to 15 feet away. The shield regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Resistant Armor
entries: While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon with the thrown property

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

optionalfeature.name: Spell-Refueling Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, the creature can recover one expended spell slot as an action. The recovered slot can be of 3rd level or lower. Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Shot
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the projectile must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes {@damage 2d6} force damage when the projectile hits it.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Shot
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this projectile to temporarily beguile its target. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is {@condition charmed|Ishiir} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed|Ishiir} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Shot
entries: You imbue your projectile with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the projectile hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Shot
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your projectile. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Shot
entries: When this projectile strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your projectile an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the projectile shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The projectile passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the projectile, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Shot
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your projectile the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The projectile flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the projectile to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the projectile disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the projectile, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Shot
entries: You weave illusion magic into your projectile, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Binding
entries: As a bonus action, you attempt to bind a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of you, which must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the cursed creature's speed is reduced to 0 and it can't use reactions until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute and can affect any creature regardless of size. The cursed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Bloated Agony
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you, causing its body to swell until the end of your next turn. For the duration, the creature has disadvantage on Strength checks and Dexterity checks, and takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage if it makes more than one attack during its turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. The cursed creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Mutant|Order of the Mutant|Ishiir}

entries: As a bonus action, you cause a creature within 30 feet of you to become {@condition poisoned|Ishiir}. The cursed creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage when you inflict this curse, and it takes this damage again each time it fails a Constitution saving throw to end the curse.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Exposure
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage from an attack or spell, you can use your reaction to temporarily weaken its resilience. Until the end of the target's next turn, it loses resistance to all the damage types dealt by the triggering attack or spell (including for that triggering effect).

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The target instead loses invulnerability to the damage types of the triggering attack or spell, but has resistance to those damage types until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Anxious
entries: As a bonus action, you harry the body or mind of a creature within 30 feet of you, making them susceptible to forceful influence. Until the end of your next turn, Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks made against the cursed creature have advantage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next Wisdom saving throw the cursed creature makes before this curse ends has disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Ghostslayer|Order of the Ghostslayer|Ishiir}

entries: As a bonus action, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is {@condition charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition frightened|Ishiir}, or which is under a possession effect. The target creature is no longer {@condition charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition frightened|Ishiir}, or possessed.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: A creature that {@condition charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition frightened|Ishiir}, or possessed the target of your curse takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Fallen Puppet
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to instill that creature with a final act of aggression. The creature immediately makes one weapon attack against a target of your choice within its range.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You can first cause the cursed creature to move up to half its speed, and you grant a bonus to its attack roll equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Howl

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Lycan|Order of the Lycan|Ishiir}

entries: As an action, you unleash a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition stunned|Ishiir} while {@condition frightened|Ishiir} in this way. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to this blood curse for the next 24 hours.
You can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by the howl.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The range of this curse increases to 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Marked
entries: As a bonus action, you mark a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your turn, whenever you hit the cursed creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you roll an additional hemocraft die when determining the extra damage from the rite.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next attack roll you make against the target before the end of your turn has advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Muddled Mind
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you that is concentrating on a spell or using a feature that requires concentration. That creature has disadvantage on the next Constitution saving throw it makes to maintain concentration before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature has disadvantage on all Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Soul Eater

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Profane Soul|Order of the Profane Soul|Ishiir}

entries: When a creature that isn't a construct or undead is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to offer their life energy to your patron in exchange for power. Until the end of your next turn, you make attacks with advantage and you have resistance to all damage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: Additionally, you regain an expended warlock spell slot. Once you've amplified this blood curse, you must finish a long rest before you can amplify it again.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of Winter
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell cone of cold|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Clench of the North Wind
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell hold person|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You can use your action to briefly control elemental forces within 30 feet of you, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

items: Create a harmless, instantaneous sensory effect related to air, earth, fire, or water, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, a spray of light mist, or a gentle rumbling of stone.
Instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
Chill or warm up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
Cause earth, fire, water, or mist that can fit within a 1-foot cube to shape itself into a crude form you designate for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Eternal Mountain Defense
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell stoneskin|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: When you use the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to cause tendrils of flame to stretch out from your fists and feet. Your reach with your unarmed strikes increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. A hit with such an attack deals fire damage instead of bludgeoning damage. If you spend 1 additional ki point when you use this feature, all unarmed strikes until the start of your next turn also deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell thunderwave|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell fireball|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Gong of the Summit
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell shatter|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Stance
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell gaseous form|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Wind
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell fly|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: River of Hungry Flame
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell wall of fire|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Rush of the Gale Spirits
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell gust of wind|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Shape the Flowing River
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 ki point to choose an area of ice or water no larger than 30 feet on a side within 120 feet of you. You can change water to ice within the area and vice versa, and you can reshape ice in the area in any manner you choose. You can raise or lower the ice's elevation, create or fill in a trench, erect or flatten a wall, or form a pillar. The extent of any such changes can't exceed half the area's largest dimension. For example, if you affect a 30-foot square, you can create a pillar up to 15 feet high. raise or lower the square's elevation by up to 15 feet, dig a trench up to 15 feet deep, and so on. You can't shape the ice to trap or injure a creature in the area.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell burning hands|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Unbroken Air
entries: You can create a blast of compressed air that strikes like a mighty fist. As an action, you can spend 2 ki points and choose a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage, plus an extra {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can push the creature up to 20 feet away from you and knock it {@condition prone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't push it or knock it {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Whip
entries: You can spend 2 ki points as an action to create a whip of water that shoves and pulls a creature to unbalance it. A creature that you can see that is within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage, plus an extra {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can either knock it {@condition prone|Ishiir} or pull it up to 25 feet closer to you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't pull it or knock it {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Wave of Rolling Earth
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell wall of stone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, add your Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: You can cast {@spell mage armor|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell levitate|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Moon
entries: You no longer need to sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as reading your Book of Shadows and keeping watch.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Bewitching Whispers
entries: You can cast {@spell compulsion|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bond of the Talisman
entries: While someone else is wearing your talisman, you can use your action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you. The teleportation can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
entries: You can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two {@filter 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list|spells|Components & Miscellaneous=ritual|level=1|source=Ishiir}. The spells needn't be from the same spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Hex
entries: When you apply your Hexblade's Curse to a creature, it also takes fire damage equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Caiphon's Beacon
entries: The purple star Caiphon is the doom of inexperienced mariners. Those who use its deceptive light to guide their travels invariably come to ruin. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and you have advantage on attack rolls against {@condition charmed|Ishiir} creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Master's Fury
entries: When you command your familiar to attack as a bonus action, it makes one additional attack. Additionally, you add your Charisma modifier to your familiar's damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: You can cast {@spell hold monster|Ishiir} at will—targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental—without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Hex
entries: When you apply your Hexblade's Curse to a creature, it and creatures within 5 feet of it also take cold damage equal to half your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Chronicle of the Raven Queen
entries: You can place a corpse's hand or similar appendage on your Book of Shadows and ask one question aloud. After 1 minute, the answer appears written in blood in your book. The answer is provided by the dead creature's spirit to the best of its knowledge and is translated into a language of your choice. You must use this ability within 1 minute of a creature's death, and a given creature can only be asked one question in this manner.

optionalfeature.name: Claw of Acamar
entries: The reach of your pact weapon increases by 5 ft. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make an Intelligence saving throw. The DC equals 8 + proficiency + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target's speed is reduced to 0 and it cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover. It lasts until you're {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir} or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

The aura grants you advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts or enters for the first time on its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0 damage).
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Curse Bringer
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Charisma saving throw. The DC equals 8 + proficiency + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target is cursed until the start of your next turn. While the target is cursed, it has to roll a {@dice d4} every time it makes an attack roll or saving throw and subtract the result from the total.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful Word
entries: You can cast {@spell confusion|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Armor
entries: As an action, you can touch a suit of armor that isn't being worn or carried by anyone and instantly don it, provided you aren't wearing armor already. You are proficient with this suit of armor until it's removed.
You also gain the benefits of the {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} for this armor, as per the {@classFeature Martial Mastery|Barbarian|Ishiir|4|Ishiir} class feature.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Smite
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target, plus another {@damage 1d8} per level of the spell slot, and you can knock the target {@condition prone|Ishiir} if it is Huge or smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, its range is 300 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
entries: You can read all writing.

optionalfeature.name: Far Scribe
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

You can cast the {@spell sending|Ishiir} spell, targeting a creature whose name is on the page, without using a spell slot and without using material components. To do so, you must write the message on the page. The target hears the message in their mind, and if the target replies, their message appears on the page, rather than in your mind. The writing disappears after 1 minute.
As an action, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You can cast {@spell false life|Ishiir} on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are {@condition blinded|Ishiir} and {@condition deafened|Ishiir} to your own surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Gaze
entries: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have {@sense darkvision} if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can also cast {@spell water breathing|Ishiir} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
entries: Whenever you regain hit points while your familiar is within 100 feet of you, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Protectors
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 hit point instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a long rest.
As an action, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Hadar
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

optionalfeature.name: Green Lord's Gift
entries: The Green Lord oversees a verdant realm of everlasting summer. Your soul is linked to his power. Whenever you regain hit points, you treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
In addition, the weapon gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon, up to a maximum of +5 for the attack roll bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When you cast {@spell find familiar|Ishiir}, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits:

items: The familiar gains either a flying speed or a swimming speed (your choice) of 40 feet.
The familiar's weapon attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks.
If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.
When the familiar takes damage, you can use your reaction to grant it resistance against that damage.
You can replace your familiar's attack roll bonus with your spell attack bonus if it is higher.
You can replace your familiar's hit point maximum with 5 x your Warlock level if it is higher.

optionalfeature.name: Kiss of Mephistopheles
entries: When you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, you can cast {@spell fireball|Ishiir} as a bonus action using a warlock spell slot. The spell must be centered on the creature you hit with {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Lance of Lethargy
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, you can reduce that creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Mace of Dispater
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC equals 8 + proficiency + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened|Ishiir} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Maddening Hex
entries: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your {@spell hex|Ishiir} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage). To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Myriad Forms
entries: You can cast {@spell alter self|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Minions of Chaos
entries: You can cast {@spell conjure elemental|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mire the Mind
entries: You can cast {@spell slow|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Misty Visions
entries: You can cast {@spell silent image|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Moon Bow
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC equals 8 + proficiency + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target sheds dim light in a 10-feet radius and cannot benefit from {@condition invisible|Ishiir|invisibility} until the start of your next turn. During that time, all attack rolls against the target have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become {@condition invisible|Ishiir} until you move or take an action or a reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: You can cast {@spell jump|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Path of the Seeker
entries: The Seeker bids you to travel in search of knowledge, and little can prevent you from walking this path. You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, have advantage on all checks to escape a grapple, manacles, or rope bindings, and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition paralyzed|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Talisman
entries: When the wearer of your talisman fails a saving throw, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Raven Queen's Blessing
entries: When you finish a long rest, you are automatically considered under the effect of the {@spell Death Ward|Ishiir} spell, but the duration lasts until you finish your next long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rebuke of the Talisman
entries: When the wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to half your Warlock level and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hex
entries: Your curse creates a temporary bond between you and your target. As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your {@spell hex|Ishiir} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

optionalfeature.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you hit a creature with {@spell eldritch blast|Ishiir}, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Sculptor of Flesh
entries: You can cast {@spell polymorph|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sea Twins' Gift
entries: The Sea Twins rule seas in the Feywild. Their gift allows you to travel through water with ease. You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can also cast {@spell water breathing|Ishiir} using a warlock spell slot. Once you cast it using this invocation, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Seeker's Speech
entries: Your quest for knowledge allows you to master any spoken language. When you complete a long rest, you can pick two languages. You gain the ability to speak, read, and write the chosen languages until you finish your next long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell invisibility|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Ulban
entries: The blue-white star Ulban maintains a fickle presence among the stars, fluttering into view only to herald a dire omen. As an action, you can turn {@condition invisible|Ishiir} for 1 minute. If you attack, deal damage, or force a creature to make a saving throw, you become visible at the end of the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sign of Ill Omen
entries: You can cast {@spell bestow curse|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

In addition, the weapon gains a +2 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon except other Pact Weapon invocations, up to a maximum of +5 for the attack roll bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Thief of Five Fates
entries: You can cast {@spell bane|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Thirsting Blade
entries: You can attack with your pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tomb of Levistus
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after you take the damage, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed is reduced to 0, and you are {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster's Escape
entries: You can cast {@spell freedom of movement|Ishiir} once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

In addition, the weapon gains a +3 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon except other Pact Weapon invocations, up to a maximum of +5 for the attack roll bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Servitude
entries: You can cast {@spell animate dead|Ishiir} without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Chain Master
entries: You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Additionally, while perceiving through your familiar's senses, you can also speak through your familiar in your own voice, even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech.

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with dead|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Witch Sight
entries: You have {@sense Truesight} with a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Odem
entries: You can spend 3 kinesis points to cast {@spell Water Breathing|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Whirlwind
entries: As an action, you can spend 2 kinesis points and make a melee attack against any number of creatures in range of your kinetic blade.

optionalfeature.name: Blazing Agony
entries: You can spend 5 kinesis points to cast {@spell Immolation|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Air or Fire Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you hit a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Bowling Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Air or Earth Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of the Sky
entries: You can cast {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC. On a failure, the target is set ablaze, burning for fire damage equal to double your proficiency modifier at the start of each of its turns.
It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Alternatively, it or another creature can use an action to douse the flames.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Gravity
entries: You can spend 2 kinesis points to cast {@spell Earthbind|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Call the Flood
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Tsunami|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 3 kinesis points to make another attack with your kinetic blast against a different creature within 30 feet of your original target. The damage of your kinetic blast is halved for this attack.

If the attack hits, you can choose to spend 1 kinesis point to target another creature within 30 feet of your second target, which cannot be your original target. You roll the attack as you did before, and halve your kinetic blast damage.
You can repeat this as long as your attacks hit, you have new targets in range to chain to, and kinesis points to spend.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic blast, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your save DC. On a failure, the creature's next attack roll before the end of its next turn is made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Command the Heavens
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Move Earth|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Earthen Grip
entries: You can cast {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Embrace of the Earth
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Stoneskin|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Entangling Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Earth or Water Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained|Ishiir} for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a Strength saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Eruption

otherSummary.entry: Fire Element; Kinetic Shape Modification, Kinetic Blast shape

entries: By spending an action and 2 kinesis points, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to explode outward in a 10-foot radius cylinder that is 40 feet high.
Every creature in the area of effect has to make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC, taking your kinetic shape damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Fan of Flames
entries: By spending an action and 1 kinesis point, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to fan outward in a 15-foot cone. Every creature in the area of effect has to make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC, taking your kinetic shape damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Foxfire Infusion
entries: You can spend 1 kinesis points to cast {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Fury of the Earth
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Earthquake|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Water
entries: You can cast {@spell Create or Destroy Water|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Ground Stomp
entries: You can cast {@spell Earth Tremor|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Herald of Storms
entries: You can spend 7 kinesis points to cast {@spell Whirlwind|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Hungry Vortex
entries: You can spend 5 kinesis points to cast {@spell Maelstrom|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Flame
entries: You can cast {@spell Continual Flame|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Imprisoning Rock
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Flesh to Stone|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Incinerate
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Disintegrate|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Healer
entries: You gain the ability to harness the cleansing properties of water.

As an action, you can touch a creature and spend a number of kinesis points up to the current total you possess and heal the creature. For each kinesis point you spend the creature is healed for {@dice 2d6} hitpoints. You can also spend 2 kinesis points to remove any one poison or disease from the creature as part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Whip
entries: The reach of your kinetic blade doubles. Additionally, creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you if they move at least 5 ft within your reach.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Earth
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Meld into Stone|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Skywalker
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Wind Walk|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Spindle Infusion
entries: By spending an action and 1 kinesis point, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to shootward in a 10-feet long, 5-feet wide spindle that travels 30 feet away from you until it disperses.
All creatures through whose spaces the spindle passes have to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking your kinetic shape damage on failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Under a Scarlet Sky
entries: You can spend 7 kinesis points to cast {@spell Fire Storm|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Walk on Water
entries: You can cast {@spell Water Walk|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wall Infusion

otherSummary.entry: None; Kinetic Shape modification, Kinetic Blast shape

entries: By spending an action and 3 kinesis points, you can use your kinetic shape to create a wall of churning elements, flensing debris, or roiling energy that lasts for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes half your kinetic shape's damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.
A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

optionalfeature.name: Water Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Water|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Watery Prison
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Watery Sphere|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Winds|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wreath of Flames
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Fire Shield|Ishiir} (warm shield), but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one {@filter maneuver|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B|source=Ishiir} of your choice from among those available to the {@class fighter|Ishiir|Battle Master|Battle Master|Ishiir|2-0} archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a {@dice d6} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a {@item shield|phb} when you make the attack roll, the {@damage d6} becomes a {@damage d8}.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to one creature {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by you.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} or a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're {@condition blinded|Ishiir} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an {@condition invisible|Ishiir} creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

optionalfeature.name: Close Quarters Shooter
entries: When making a ranged attack while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll. Your ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of you. You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls on ranged attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Tunnel Fighter
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter a defensive stance that lasts until the start of your next turn. While in your defensive stance, you can make opportunity attacks without using your reaction, and you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against a creature that moves more than 5 feet while within your reach.

optionalfeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. They count as paladin spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=druid (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. They count as ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Aether
entries: You have a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. However, you have disadvantage on Strength checks and Dexterity checks during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma checks. However, you have disadvantage on initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws. Your Dexterity score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Conversant
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence checks. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom checks.

optionalfeature.name: Cruelty
entries: When you use the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can make one additional weapon attack as a bonus action. However, you have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Deftness
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity checks. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom checks.

optionalfeature.name: Embers
entries: You have resistance to fire damage and vulnerability to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gelid
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and vulnerability to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Impermeable
entries: You have resistance to piercing damage and vulnerability to slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mobility
entries: You have immunity to the {@condition grappled|Ishiir} and {@condition restrained|Ishiir} conditions. However, you have disadvantage on Strength checks. At 11th level, you are also immune to the {@condition paralyzed|Ishiir} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Nighteye
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. However, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Percipient
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom checks. However, you have disadvantage on Charisma checks.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. Your Strength score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. However, you have disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet. However, you have disadvantage on Intelligence checks. At 15th level, your speed increases by an additional 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns when you have at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. However, your speed is reduced by 10 feet during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Charisma saving throws. Your Intelligence score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded
entries: You have resistance to slashing damage, and you have vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning damage, and you have vulnerability to piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. However, you have disadvantage on death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell.
When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.
If the affected spell requires concentration, you have advantage on any saving throw you make to maintain that concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 2 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on all its saving throws made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Maximized Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 2 sorcery points and choose a number damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You maximize the rolled result for the chosen dice.
You can use Maximized Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 sorcery points to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic, verbal and material components, unless that material component has a cost or is consumed by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, {@spell magic missile|Ishiir} and {@spell scorching ray|Ishiir} aren't eligible, but {@spell ray of frost|Ishiir} and {@spell chromatic orb|Ishiir} are.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or an initiative roll, you can expend one superiority die and add the die to the roll, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Bait and Switch
entries: When you're within 5 feet of a creature on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and switch places with that creature, provided you spend at least 5 feet of movement and the creature is willing and isn't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Roll the superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, you or the other creature (your choice) gains a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Brace
entries: When a creature you can see moves into the reach you have with the melee weapon you're wielding, you can use your reaction to expend one superiority die and make one attack against the creature, using that weapon. If the attack hits, add the superiority die to the weapon's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Commanding Presence
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}), a Charisma ({@skill Performance}), or a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and take the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} action. You also roll the die and add the result to your AC until the end of the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Feinting Attack
entries: You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll against that creature this turn. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and then try to grapple the target as a bonus action (see the Player's Handbook for rules on grappling). Add the superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and take the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action. If you move at least 10 ft in a straight line immediately before hitting with a melee weapon attack on this turn, you add the superiority die to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Maneuvering Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of your attack.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + STR or DEX modifier (your choice) + fighter level.

optionalfeature.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Pushing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Toss
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and make a ranged attack with a weapon that has the thrown property. You can draw the weapon as part of making this attack. If you hit, add the superiority die to the weapon's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Rally
entries: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Restraining Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action to grapple the target (see chapter 9 in the Player's Handbook for rules on grappling). Add the superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. The target is also {@condition restrained|Ishiir} while {@condition grappled|Ishiir} in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check or a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Snipe
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and make a ranged weapon attack. You can draw a thrown weapon as part of making this attack. If you hit, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock a target off-balance. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Studious Eye
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check or an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Assessment
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), an Intelligence ({@skill History}), or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Absorption
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage to the named target, you gain {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points. The number of temporary hit points you gain increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 10th level ({@dice 4d6}) and 14th level ({@dice 5d6}) in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Devastation
entries: If the spell requires the named creature to make a saving throw, that creature has disadvantage on the first save it makes against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Dissolution
entries: The first time the named creature takes damage from the spell, that creature takes an extra {@damage 2d8} force damage. The extra force damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach 10th level ({@damage 3d8}) and 14th level ({@damage 4d8}) in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Nullification
entries: If the named target is affected by any other spells, you know what those spells are, and you can attempt to end one of your choice by succeeding on an Intelligence check with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the chosen spell.
