spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you may use a bonus action to make your weapon ring with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

spell.name: Thunderwave
entries: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tidal Wave

components.m: a drop of water

entries: You conjure up a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

spell.name: Time Ravage

m.text: an hourglass filled with diamond dust worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: You target a creature you can see within range, putting its physical form through the devastation of rapid aging. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 15d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the save fails, the target also ages to the point where it has only 30 days left before it dies of old age. In this aged state, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and its walking speed is halved. Only the {@spell wish|Ishiir} spell or the {@spell greater restoration|Ishiir} cast with a 9th-level spell slot can end these effects and restore the target to its previous age.

spell.name: Time Stop
entries: You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take 5 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal.

This spell ends if one of the actions you use during this period, or any effects that you create during this period, affects a creature other than you or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you. In addition, the spell ends if you move to a place more than 1,000 feet from the location where you cast it.

spell.name: Tiny Servant
entries: You touch one Tiny, nonmagical object that isn't attached to another object or a surface and isn't being carried by another creature. The target animates and sprouts little arms and legs, becoming a creature under your control until the spell ends or the creature drops to 0 hit points. See the {@creature tiny servant|xge|stat block} for its statistics.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command the creature if it is within 120 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures with this spell, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a simple, general command, such as to fetch a key, stand watch, or stack some books. If you issue no commands, the servant does nothing other than defend itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the servant continues to follow that order until its task is complete.
When the creature drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Toll the Dead
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8} or {@damage 2d12}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8} or {@damage 3d12}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8} or {@damage 4d12}).

spell.name: Tongues

components.m: a small clay model of a ziggurat

entries: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

spell.name: Transmute Rock

components.m: clay and water

entries: You choose an area of stone or mud that you can see that fits within a 40-foot cube and is within range, and choose one of the following effects.

entries.name: Transmute Rock to Mud
entries: Nonmagical rock of any sort in the area becomes an equal volume of thick, flowing mud that remains for the spell's duration.

The ground in the spell's area becomes muddy enough that creatures can sink into it. Each foot that a creature moves through the mud costs 4 feet of movement, and any creature on the ground when you cast the spell must make a Strength saving throw. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. On a failed save, a creature sinks into the mud and is {@condition restrained|Ishiir}, though it can use an action to end the {@condition restrained|Ishiir} condition on itself by pulling itself free of the mud.

If you cast the spell on a ceiling, the mud falls. Any creature under the mud when it falls must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Transmute Mud to Rock
entries: Nonmagical mud or quicksand in the area no more than 10 feet deep transforms into soft stone for the spell's duration. Any creature in the mud when it transforms must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, a creature is shunted safely to the surface in an unoccupied space. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the rock. A {@condition restrained|Ishiir} creature, or another creature within reach, can use an action to try to break the rock by succeeding on a DC 20 Strength check or by dealing damage to it. The rock has AC 15 and 25 hit points, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.

spell.name: Transport via Plants
entries: This spell creates a magical link between a Large or larger inanimate plant within range and another plant, at any distance, on the same plane of existence. You must have seen or touched the destination plant at least once before. For the duration, any creature can step into the target plant and exit from the destination plant by using 5 feet of movement.

spell.name: Tree Stride
entries: You gain the ability to enter a tree and move from inside it to inside another tree of the same kind within 500 feet. Both trees must be living and at least the same size as you. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a tree. You instantly know the location of all other trees of the same kind within 500 feet and, as part of the move used to enter the tree, can either pass into one of those trees or step out of the tree you're in. You appear in a spot of your choice within 5 feet of the destination tree, using another 5 feet of movement. If you have no movement left, you appear within 5 feet of the tree you entered.
You can use this transportation ability once per round for the duration. You must end each turn outside a tree.

spell.name: True Polymorph

components.m: a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke

entries: Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. You transform the creature into a different creature, the creature into a nonmagical object, or the object into a creature (the object must be neither worn nor carried by another creature). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation lasts until it is dispelled.
This spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points. An unwilling creature can make a Constitution saving throw, and if it succeeds, it isn't affected by this spell.

entries.name: Creature into Creature
entries: If you turn a creature into another kind of creature, the new form can be any kind you choose whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or its level, if the target doesn't have a challenge rating), up to a maximum of 20. The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the new form. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious|Ishiir}.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech unless its new form is capable of such actions.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

entries.name: Object into Creature
entries: You can turn an object into any kind of creature, as long as the creature's size is no larger than the object's size and the creature's challenge rating is {@filter 9 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&9]|miscellaneous=!swarm}. The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It acts on each of your turns. You decide what action it takes and how it moves. The DM has the creature's statistics and resolves all of its actions and movement.
If the spell becomes permanent, you no longer control the creature. It might remain friendly to you, depending on how you have treated it.

entries.name: Creature into Object
entries: If you turn a creature into an object, it transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form, as long as the object's size is no larger than the creature's size. The creature's statistics become those of the object, and the creature has no memory of time spent in this form, after the spell ends and it returns to its normal form.

spell.name: True Resurrection

m.text: a sprinkle of holy water and diamonds worth at least 25,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 200 years and that died for any reason except old age. If the creature's soul is free and willing, the creature is restored to life with all its hit points.

This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses affecting the creature when it died. The spell replaces damaged or missing organs and limbs. If the creature was undead, it is restored to its non-undead form.

The spell can even provide a new body if the original no longer exists, in which case you must speak the creature's name. The creature then appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 10 feet of you.

spell.name: True Seeing

m.text: an ointment for the eyes that costs 25 gp; is made from mushroom powder, saffron, and fat; and is consumed by the spell

entries: This spell gives the willing creature you touch the ability to see things as they actually are. For the duration, the creature has {@sense truesight}, notices secret doors hidden by magic, and can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 120 feet.

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You extend your hand and point a finger at a creature you can see within range. Your magic grants your target a brief insight into the defenses of its enemies. On its next turn, it gains advantage on its first attack roll, provided that this spell hasn't ended.

spell.name: Tsunami
entries: A wall of water springs into existence at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 300 feet long, 300 feet high, and 50 feet thick. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

At the start of each of your turns after the wall appears, the wall, along with any creatures in it, moves 50 feet away from you. Any Huge or smaller creature inside the wall or whose space the wall enters when it moves must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round. At the end of the turn, the wall's height is reduced by 50 feet, and the damage creatures take from the spell on subsequent rounds is reduced by {@dice 1d10}. When the wall reaches 0 feet in height, the spell ends.

A creature caught in the wall can move by swimming. Because of the force of the wave, though, the creature must make a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC in order to move at all. If it fails the check, it can't move. A creature that moves out of the area falls to the ground.

spell.name: Unseen Servant

components.m: a piece of string and a bit of wood

entries: This spell creates an {@condition invisible|Ishiir}, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

spell.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d10|3-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Virulent Doom

m.text: a skull adorned with an emerald worth at least 5000 gp

entries: You inflict up to 10 creatures that you can see within range with a deadly magical disease.

Each target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target suffers {@damage 7d12} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned|Ishiir} for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned|Ishiir}.

At the end of each of a target's {@condition poisoned|Ishiir} turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. If a target succeeds on 3 of these saves, it is no longer poisoned. If a target fails 3 of these saves, it dies.

spell.name: Vitriolic Sphere

components.m: a drop of giant slug bile

entries: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d4} acid damage and another {@damage 5d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d4|4-9|2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Voracious Poison

components.m: a drop of blood and an adder's tongue

entries: You inflict the blood of one creature you can see within range with a terrible poison that eats it from the inside out.

The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition poisoned|Ishiir} for the duration. At the end of each of the target's turns before the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 16d8} poison damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Wall of Fire

components.m: a small piece of phosphorus

entries: You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals {@damage 5d8} fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wall of Force

components.m: a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone

entries: An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by {@spell dispel magic|Ishiir}. A {@spell disintegrate|Ishiir} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

spell.name: Wall of Ice

components.m: a small piece of quartz

entries: You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 hit points per 10-foot section, and it is vulnerable to fire damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn must make a Constitution saving throw. That creature takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage the wall deals when it appears increases by {@scaledamage 10d6|6-9|2d6}, and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by {@scaledamage 5d6|6-9|1d6}, for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Light

components.m: a hand mirror

entries: A shimmering wall of bright light appears at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight, but creatures and objects can pass through it. It emits bright light out to 120 feet and dim light for an additional 120 feet.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage, and it is {@condition blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded|Ishiir}. A {@condition blinded|Ishiir} creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A creature that ends its turn in the wall's area takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage.

Until the spell ends, you can use an action to launch a beam of radiance from the wall at one creature you can see within 60 feet of it. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage. Whether you hit or miss, reduce the length of the wall by 10 feet. If the wall's length drops to 0 feet, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Sand

components.m: a handful of sand

entries: You create a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is {@condition blinded|Ishiir} while in the wall's space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.

spell.name: Wall of Stone

components.m: a small block of granite

entries: A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is 6 inches thick and is composed of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with at least one other panel. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20-foot panels that are only 3 inches thick.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.

The wall can have any shape you desire, though it can't occupy the same space as a creature or object. The wall doesn't need to be vertical or rest on any firm foundation. It must, however, merge with and be solidly supported by existing stone. Thus, you can use this spell to bridge a chasm or create a ramp.
If you create a span greater than 20 feet in length, you must halve the size of each panel to create supports. You can crudely shape the wall to create crenellations, battlements, and so on.

The wall is an object made of stone that can be damaged and thus breached. Each panel has AC 15 and 30 hit points per inch of thickness. Reducing a panel to 0 hit points destroys it and might cause connected panels to collapse at the DM's discretion.
If you maintain your concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the wall becomes permanent and can't be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.

spell.name: Wall of Thorns

components.m: a handful of thorns

entries: You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d8} piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, the first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d8} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both types of damage increase by {@scaledamage 7d8|6-9|1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Water

components.m: a drop of water

entries: You create a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends. The wall's space is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

Any ranged weapon attack that enters the wall's space has disadvantage on the attack roll, and fire damage is halved if the fire effect passes through the wall to reach its target. Spells that deal cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze solid (at least a 5-foot-square section is frozen). Each 5-foot-square frozen section has AC 5 and 15 hit points. Reducing a frozen section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the wall's water doesn't fill it.

spell.name: Warding Bond

m.text: a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration

entries: This spell wards a willing creature you touch and creates a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures. You can also dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Warding Whip
entries: When you cast the spell and as an action on your subsequent turns, you can choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 7th level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 8th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

spell.name: Warding Wind
entries: A strong wind (20 miles per hour) blows around you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. The wind lasts for the spell's duration.
The wind has the following effects:

items: It {@condition deafened|Ishiir|deafens} you and other creatures in its area.
It extinguishes unprotected flames in its area that are torch-sized or smaller.
It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind.
The area is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for creatures other than you.
The attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks have disadvantage if the attacks pass in or out of the wind.

spell.name: Water Breathing

components.m: a short reed or piece of straw

entries: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

spell.name: Water Walk

components.m: a piece of cork

entries: This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface—such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava—as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.
If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

spell.name: Watery Sphere

components.m: a droplet of water

entries: You conjure up a sphere of water with a 5-foot radius at a point you can see within range. The sphere can hover but no more than 10 feet off the ground. The sphere remains for the spell's duration.

Any creature in the sphere's space must make a Strength saving throw. On a successful save, a creature is ejected from that space to the nearest unoccupied space of the creature's choice outside the sphere. A Huge or larger creature succeeds on the saving throw automatically, and a Large or smaller creature can choose to fail it. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the sphere and is engulfed by the water. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition restrained|Ishiir} target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The sphere can restrain as many as four Medium or smaller creatures or one Large creature. If the sphere restrains a creature that causes it to exceed this capacity, a random creature that was already {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the sphere falls out of it and lands {@condition prone|Ishiir} in a space within 5 feet of it.

As an action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet in a straight line. If it moves over a pit, a cliff, or other drop-off, it safely descends until it is hovering 10 feet above the ground. Any creature {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the sphere moves with it. You can ram the sphere into creatures, forcing them to make the saving throw.

When the spell ends, the sphere falls to the ground and extinguishes all normal flames within 30 feet of it. Any creature {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the sphere is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir} in the space where it falls. The water then vanishes.

spell.name: Web

components.m: a bit of spiderweb

entries: You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration. The webs are {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and lightly obscure their area.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained|Ishiir} as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.
A creature {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the webs can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained|Ishiir}.
The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing {@damage 2d4} fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

spell.name: Weird
entries: Drawing on the deepest fears of a group of creatures, you create illusory creatures in their minds, visible only to them. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened|Ishiir} for the duration. The illusion calls on the creature's deepest fears, manifesting its worst nightmares as an implacable threat. At the end of each of the {@condition frightened|Ishiir} creature's turns, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 11d10} psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

spell.name: Whirlwind

components.m: a piece of straw

entries: A whirlwind howls down to a point that you can see on the ground within range. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any Medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind or that the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained|Ishiir} in the whirlwind until the spell ends. When a creature starts its turn {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the whirlwind, the creature is pulled 5 feet higher inside it, unless the creature is at the top. A {@condition restrained|Ishiir} creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends, unless the creature has some means to stay aloft.

A {@condition restrained|Ishiir} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. If successful, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the whirlwind and is hurled {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet away from it in a random direction.

spell.name: Wind Walk

components.m: fire and holy water

entries: You and up to ten willing creatures you can see within range assume a gaseous form for the duration, appearing as wisps of cloud. While in this cloud form, a creature has a flying speed of 300 feet and has resistance to damage from nonmagical weapons. The only actions a creature can take in this form are the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action or to revert to its normal form. Reverting takes 1 minute, during which time a creature is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir} and can't move. Until the spell ends, a creature can revert to cloud form, which also requires the 1-minute transformation.

If a creature is in cloud form and flying when the effect ends, the creature descends 60 feet per round for 1 minute until it lands, which it does safely. If it can't land after 1 minute, the creature falls the remaining distance.

spell.name: Wind Wall

components.m: a tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin

entries: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

spell.name: Wish
entries: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal creature can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter the very foundations of reality in accord with your desires.

The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of 8th level or lower. You don't need to meet any requirements in that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect. Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice:

items: You create one object of up to 25,000 gp in value that isn't a magic item. The object can be no more than 300 feet in any dimension, and it appears in an unoccupied space you can see on the ground.
You allow up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all hit points, and you end all effects on them described in the {@spell greater restoration|Ishiir} spell.
You grant up to ten creatures that you can see resistance to a damage type you choose.

You grant up to ten creatures you can see immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours. For instance, you could make yourself and all your companions immune to a {@creature lich}'s life drain attack.

You undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. For example, a {@spell wish|Ishiir} spell could undo an opponent's successful save, a foe's critical hit, or a friend's failed save. You can force the reroll to be made with advantage or disadvantage, and you can choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

entries: You might be able to achieve something beyond the scope of the above examples. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM has great latitude in ruling what occurs in such an instance; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might only be partly achieved, or you might suffer some unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish. For example, wishing that a villain were dead might propel you forward in time to a period when that villain is no longer alive, effectively removing you from the game. Similarly, wishing for a legendary magic item or artifact might instantly transport you to the presence of the item's current owner.

The stress of casting this spell to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a long rest, you take {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength drops to 3, if it isn't 3 or lower already, for {@dice 2d4} days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a {@chance 33|||Unable to cast again!|Able to cast again} chance that you are unable to cast wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

spell.name: Witch Bolt

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal {@damage 1d12} lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|1-9|1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Word of Radiance

components.m: a holy symbol

entries: You utter a divine word, and burning radiance erupts from you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Word of Recall
entries: You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

spell.name: Wrath of Nature
entries: You call out to the spirits of nature to rouse them against your enemies. Choose a point you can see within range. The spirits cause trees, rocks, and grasses in a 60-foot cube centered on that point to become animated until the spell ends.

entries.name: Grasses and Undergrowth
entries: Any area of ground in the cube that is covered by grass or undergrowth is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies.

entries.name: Trees
entries: At the start of each of your turns, each of your enemies within 10 feet of any tree in the cube must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} slashing damage from whipping branches.

entries.name: Roots and Vines
entries: At the end of each of your turns, one creature of your choice that is on the ground in the cube must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained|Ishiir} until the spell ends. A {@condition restrained|Ishiir} creature can use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Rocks
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause a loose rock in the cube to launch at a creature you can see in the cube. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} nonmagical bludgeoning damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you may use a bonus action have your weapon deal an extra {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|Ishiir} of you until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Wisdom check against your spell save DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

spell.name: Wristpocket
entries: You flick your wrist, causing one object in your hand to vanish. The object, which only you can be holding and can weigh no more than 5 pounds, is transported to an extradimensional space, where it remains for the duration.

Until the spell ends, you can use your action to summon the object to your free hand, and you can use your action to return the object to the extradimensional space. An object still in the pocket plane when the spell ends appears in your space, at your feet.

spell.name: Zephyr Strike
entries: You move like the wind. Until the spell ends, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

spell.name: Zone of Truth
entries: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt an avian aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes of a bird of prey, sharp nails, and wings sprouting from your back.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. If you are not shifted, you have to end your flying movement on the ground.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Winged Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 120 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 120 ft to its range.
Your speed increases by 10 feet and you do not provoke opportunity attacks when you fly out of an enemy's reach.

If you move at a downwards angle for at least 20 ft in a straight line before making a melee attack with your natural weapons, you can add 1 point of damage for every 5 ft travelled in this manner to the damage roll of that attack and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Strong Wings
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you no longer need to end your flying movement on the ground while not shifted.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Winged Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: While flying, you can hide as a bonus action and your wings cause no sound when you move while flying.

When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Your critical range with your natural weapons increases by 1. When you critically hit a creature it has to make a Constitutions saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition dazed|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Clawed Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a feline aspect, granting you physical traits such as the vertical pupils, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition lacerated|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Creatures who cannot bleed are immune to this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Clawed Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill. If you are already proficient, you double your proficiency bonus for all checks made with this skill. You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are surprised.
You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed and when you take fall damage, you can use your reaction to decrease that damage by an amount equal to five times your Shifter level.

When you make an attack with your natural weapons against a creature that is {@condition prone|Ishiir} or {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can use your bonus action to attempt to {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple} the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Claws
entries: Beginning at 13th level, when you inflict the {@condition lacerated|Ishiir} condition on a creature using your Clawed Aspect feature, the damage the creature takes is equal to thrice your proficiency modifier, rather than twice.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Clawed Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: If you attack a creature that you are hidden from, all your attacks that turn deal an additional {@damage 1d12} damage. If the target creature is also surprised, that damage increases to {@damage 2d12}.
On your turn, you can use your bonus action to give yourself a +2 bonus to your AC.

When you make an attack with your natural weapons against a creature that is {@condition prone|Ishiir}, {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by you, or {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can add +5 to the attack's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fanged Aspect
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a canine aspect, granting you physical traits such as the piercing eyes, sharp nails, and elongated canines.
You gain a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already possess {@sense darkvision}, add 60 ft to its range.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with your natural weapons, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}. The DC for this is 8 + your proficiency + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If the target creature is already {@condition prone|Ishiir}, you can attempt to {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple} it instead, using the usual skill check instead of forcing a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Fanged Aspect
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: You have advantage on attack rolls with your natural weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

You can take the {@action Help|Ishiir} action as a bonus action. You can always use the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to give someone advantage on a skill check, even if you are not proficient in the relevant skill yourself.
If you knock a creature {@condition prone|Ishiir} with your Fanged Aspect feature, that creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tenacious Fangs
entries: Beginning at 13th level, creatures have disadvantage on skill checks to avoid being {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by you if they are {@condition prone|Ishiir} and disadvantage on skill checks to escape your {@condition grappled|Ishiir|grapple}.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Fanged Aspect
entries: At 18th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

items: When a creature within 5 ft of you is hit by a melee attack from one of your allies, you can use your reaction to immediately force that creature to make a Strength saving throw as per your Fanged Aspect feature.

You gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to the number of allied creatures within 30 ft of you. You do not gain this bonus for an ally that is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir} or {@condition dominated|Ishiir}.
When you fail a Strength or Constitution saving throw, you can use your reaction to reroll it, taking either result.

subclassFeature.name: Bonded Spells
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, if you cast a spell on yourself, you can choose to cast the spell on your Eidolon instead if you can see it within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Evolution Feat
entries: At 3rd level, you learn an additional evolution feat for which you meet the prequisites.

subclassFeature.name: Empower Eidolon
entries: At 7th level, you learn how to spend your own magical reserves to empower your Eidolon's attacks. As a bonus action, you can spend a spell slot if you can see your Eidolon within 60 feet of you. For 1 hour, you add {@dice 1d8} times the level of the spell slot expended to your Eidolon's damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Call
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to call your Eidolon to your side. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Transposition
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to switch positions with your Eidolon if you can see it.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Evolution Feat
entries: At 14th level, you learn an additional evolution feat for which you meet the prequisites.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Eidolon
entries: At 18th level, your Eidolon becomes an absolutely monstrosity. A true thing of legend and terror. Your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity (your choice) and Constitution increase by 4. And its maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Recovery
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have learned to regain some of your magical energy by drawning from the essence of the planes. Once per long rest when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your summoner level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 3rd level or higher.
For example, if you're a 4th-level summoner, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots.
You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Focus
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to read the barriers between the planes, making it easier for you to draw forth more powerful creatures. You have a number of planar focus points equal to your summoner level.

When you expend a spell slot to cast a conjuration or necromancy spell to summon one or more creatures, you can spend a number of planar focus points up to half your proficiency modifier (rounded down). You can treat the spell slot as a number of levels higher equal to the number of planar focus points spent.
You regain all planar focus points when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Army of One
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you learn how to summon an ever-increasing number of creatures to your side. When you cast a conjuration or necromancy spell to summon a creature, you can choose to ignore the concentration limit on that spell. But if you do so, you reduce the spell's duration to 1 minute.
If you lose concentration, you lose it on all spells you're concentrating on.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Call
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to call your Eidolon to your side. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Transposition
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to switch positions with your Eidolon if you can see it.

subclassFeature.name: Host Caller's Link
entries: Beginning at 14th level, when you use the Summoner's Call or Transposition class feature, you can target another creature you have summoned instead of your Eidolon.

subclassFeature.name: Throw Wide the Gates
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can cast the {@spell Gate|Ishiir} spell without expending a spell slot and without a material component. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiosis
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to meld with your Eidolon's essence, two creatures merged as one, fighting in perfect unison.
As an action, when you are within 5 feet of your Eidolon, you can merge forms with it, entering Symbiosis. The resulting form can be that of your Eidolon, your own, or something in-between.

In this form, you gain all your Eidolon's features and evolution feats, and you choose whether to use your own or your Eidolon's stats for each ability score and armor class. You gain your Eidolon's hitpoints as temporary hitpoints. All features and effects that normally affect your Eidolon's hitpoints affect these temporary hitpoints as well. If these temporary hitpoints reach 0, your Eidolon disappears and you lose the benefits of Symbiosis and revert to your normal form. You can also relinquish the Symbiosis and split up into a summoner and Eidolon as an action.
You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the Eidolon.
You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them. And you can use any special senses available to your Eidolon and you.

When you transform, you choose whether your equipment merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the form's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must merge into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.

While in this form, you can cast all summoner spells as a bonus action. Summoner class features that normally require you to be separate entities to work, allow you to target a different beneficiary instead, treating it as the summoner. In the case of Twin Eidolon, you instead completely duplicate your merged form for the duration and it receives all benefits from equipment that you are wearing and currently using in that form as well.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Defense
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, when you are in Symbiosis, you can gain a bonus to your AC and saving throws equal to half your proficiency (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Reflexes
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws and you gain a second reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Step
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can cast {@spell Dimension Door|Ishiir} without a verbal component. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Two Minds, One Body
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws while you are in Symbiosis.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Coordination
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you can take an additional action and bonus action on your turn.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest or you spend a spell slot of 4th level to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Air
entries: Kineticists who focus on the element of air are called aerokineticists. Aerokineticists often control air flow or electricity, specializing in mobility and ranged combat.

subclassFeature.name: Air Blast
entries: When you gain access to this element, your kinetic shape gains the ability to inflict bludgeoning or lightning damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Aerokinesis
entries: When you gain access to this element, you learn the {@spell Gust|Ishiir} cantrip, which you can cast using only its somatic component.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Defense: Enveloping Winds
entries: When you gain access to this element, as a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a whirling torrent of air or a static field of crackling lightning, which lasts until you dismiss the effect (no action required).

While the effect is active and you aren't wearing any armor or shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier and all ranged weapon attacks against you are made with disadvantage. Additionally, any gas, vapor, or fog that can be dispersed by a strong wind has no effect on you.
This effect is exclusive with Elemental Defense class features from other Elemental Schools.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you gain access to this element, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Performance}.

subclassFeature.name: Light as Air
entries: When you have access to this element at 7th level, you gain the ability to use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your kineticist level.
Additionally, your standing and running jumps use Charisma instead of Strength to determine the distance you cover.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Shroud
entries: When you have access to this element at 10th level, you learn how to use your control of the air streams around you to help you dodge or otherwise ward off certain area effects, like the explosion of a fireball or a dragon's breath.

When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Wind Walker
entries: When you have access to this element at 15th level, your mastery of the wind allows you to move freely through the air. You gain a flying speed equal to 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Hurricane Queen
entries: When you have access to this element at 20th level, your mastery of air allows you to infuse your own self with the essence of storms.
As an action, you undergo the transformation and gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You ignore all wind-based effects such as the {@spell Whirlwind|Ishiir} spell or even a natural tornado.
You gain immunity to lightning damage.

You are surrounded by a 60 foot radius aura of stormlike winds of such intensity that they render ranged weapon attacks against you completely impossible. You and any number of creatures of your choice in the area are unaffected.

Any other creature is {@condition deafened|Ishiir} while in this area, must spend 4 feet for every 1 foot of movement while in it, and has to succeed on a Strength saving throw against your save DC at the start of its turn or when it enters the area for the first time or be knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir} or hurled 20 feet away in a direction that you choose.

entries: Once you have used this ability, you can't use it again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Earth
entries: Kineticists who focus on the element of earth are called geokineticists. Geokineticists manipulate the earth itself, and they are masters of defensive techniques.

subclassFeature.name: Earth Blast
entries: When you gain access to this element, your kinetic shape gains the ability to inflict bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Geokinesis
entries: When you gain access to this element, you learn the {@spell Mold Earth|Ishiir} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Defense: Flesh of Stone
entries: When you gain access to this element, as a bonus action, you can harden your body like stone, dampening the impact of most attacks until you dismiss the effect (no action required).

While the effect is active and you aren't wearing any armor or shield, your AC equals 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier and any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing you take is reduced by an amount equal to half your kineticist level (rounded down), this reduction applies before any other effect.
This effect is exclusive with Elemental Defense class features from other Elemental Schools.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you gain access to this element, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Perception}.

subclassFeature.name: Earthen Attunement
entries: When you have access to this element at 7th level, you learn how to use your connection to earth to meld slightly into stone and earthen surfaces, granting you a climb speed equal to your walking speed when climbing such surfaces.
Additionally, when you have to make a Strength saving throw or check, you can make a Charisma saving throw or check instead.

subclassFeature.name: Diamond Skin
entries: When you have access to this element at 10th level, you learn to harden specific areas of your body in response to physical trauma. When an effect makes you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to halve the effect's damage against you.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Earth
entries: When you have access to this element at 15th level, your mastery of the earth allows you to move freely through the ground. You gain a burrow speed equal to your walking speed and {@sense tremorsense|MM} in a radius of 60 feet around you.

subclassFeature.name: Striding Giant
entries: When you have access to this element at 20th level, your mastery of earth allows you to infuse your own self with the essence of the mountain.
As an action, you undergo the transformation and gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Your size changes the huge and you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your kineticist level.

You are immune to the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir|Exhausted}, {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}, {@condition Petrified|Ishiir}, and {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} conditions.
You ignore all earth-based effects such as the {@spell Erupting Earth|Ishiir} spell or even a natural earthquake.

When you move for the first time on your turn, your steps shake the earth. All creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you have to make a Strength saving throw against your save DC or be knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

entries: Once you have used this ability, you can't use it again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fire
entries: Kineticists who focus on the element of fire are called pyrokineticists. Pyrokineticists wield elemental fire as a potent weapon, and they possess a powerful offense.

subclassFeature.name: Fire Blast
entries: When you gain access to this element, your kinetic shape gains the ability to inflict fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pyrokinesis
entries: When you gain access to this element, you learn the {@spell Control Flames|Ishiir} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Defense: Searing Flesh
entries: When you gain access to this element, as a bonus action, you can superheat your body to extreme temperatures, which lasts until you dismiss the effect (no action required).

While the effect is active and you aren't wearing any armor or shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier and any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
This effect is exclusive with Elemental Defense class features from other Elemental Schools.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you gain access to this element, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Fire
entries: When you have access to this element at 7th level, your eyes begin to glow with your inner fire, giving you a {@sense darkvision} range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, your {@sense darkvision} instead increases by 30 feet.
In addition, fire and smoke caused by fire cannot obscure your vision.

subclassFeature.name: Consuming Flames
entries: When you have access to this element at 10th level, your flames grow extraordinarily intense. You ignore resistance to fire damage and treat immunity to fire damage as resistance instead.

subclassFeature.name: Fire's Fury
entries: When you have access to this element at 15th level, you have learned to direct your inner fire to lash out at attackers. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make the attacker take fire damage equal to your kineticist level.

subclassFeature.name: Fire Lord
entries: When you have access to this element at 20th level, your mastery of fire allows you to infuse your own self with the essence of flame.
As an action, you undergo the transformation and gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You shed bright light in a 60 feet radius and dim light in a radius of 30 feet beyond that.
You gain immunity to fire damage.
Creatures in the bright light have disadvantage on saving throws against infusions that include the fire element.

You radiate intense heat in a 10 feet radius around you. Any creature of your choice that enters that radius for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, takes half your kinetic shape damage.

entries: Once you have used this ability, you can't use it again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Water
entries: Kineticists who focus on the element of water are called hydrokineticists. Hydrokineticists master the flow of water or the numbing chill of cold, and they are known for their versatility and flowing forms, like the ever-changing currents.

subclassFeature.name: Water Blast
entries: When you gain access to this element, your kinetic shape gains the ability to inflict cold or bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Hydrokinesis
entries: When you gain access to this element, you learn the {@spell Shape Water|Ishiir} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Defense: Shroud of Water
entries: When you gain access to this element, you can surround yourself with a shroud of water, ice, or both that protects you from harm, which lasts until you dismiss the effect (no action required).
While this effect is active and you are not wearing any armor or shield, your AC equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.
This effect is exclusive with Elemental Defense class features from other Elemental Schools.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you gain access to this element, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Persuasion}, or {@skill Stealth}.

subclassFeature.name: Like a Fish
entries: When you have access to this element at 7th level, your attunement to the element of water allows you to move within it just as easily as on land. You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed and you can breathe underwater. If you already have a swim speed, that swim speed instead increases by 30 feet.
Additionally, you make any {@skill Athletics} checks and saving throws related to swimming or resisting water-based effects using your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifer.

subclassFeature.name: Hydrosophic Shield
entries: When you have access to this element at 10th level, you have learned to summon up your water-based defenses at a split-second's notice.

When you are hit by an attack or subject to an effect that forces you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to create a shield of water around you, granting yourself half-cover until the start of your next turn.
This cover applies even when against effects that normally ignore cover.

subclassFeature.name: Be like Water
entries: When you have access to this element at 15th level, you have learned to embody the evershifting, ungraspable nature of your element.

When you are {@condition grappled|Ishiir} or {@condition restrained|Ishiir} on your turn, you can spend 5 feet of movement to no longer be {@condition grappled|Ishiir} or {@condition restrained|Ishiir}. You also gain {@sense blindsight} in a 30 feet radius.

subclassFeature.name: Empress of the Fathoms
entries: When you have access to this element at 20th level, your mastery of water allows you to infuse your own self with the essence of waves.
As an action, you undergo the transformation and gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You ignore all water-based effects such as the {@spell Tsunami|Ishiir} spell or a natural vortex.
You gain immunity to cold damage.

Water flows from everywhere, including up from the ground and dropping as rain to form a vortex of writhing watery tentacles in a 60 feet radius around you that makes the area {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. You and any number of creatures of your choice in the area unaffected.

Any other creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there has to make a Dexterity saving throw against your save DC or be {@condition grappled|Ishiir} and {@condition restrained|Ishiir}. It can make a Strength check as an action on its turn to no longer be {@condition grappled|Ishiir} and {@condition restrained|Ishiir}.

entries: Once you have used this ability, you can't use it again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Abjuration
entries: The School of Abjuration emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects. Detractors of this school say that its tradition is about denial, negation rather than positive assertion. You understand, however, that ending harmful effects, protecting the weak, and banishing evil influences is anything but a philosophical void. It is a proud and respected vocation.

Called abjurers, members of this school are sought when baleful spirits require exorcism, when important locations must be guarded against magical spying, and when portals to other planes of existence must be closed.

subclassFeature.name: Abjuration Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy an abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Ward
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an {@filter abjuration spell of 1st level or higher|spells|school=A|level=!0|source=Ishiir}, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has a hit point maximum equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.

While the ward has 0 hit points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains. Whenever you cast an {@filter abjuration spell of 1st level or higher|spells|school=A|level=!0|source=Ishiir}, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell.
Once you create the ward, you can't create it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Projected Ward
entries: Starting at 6th level, when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Abjuration
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell (as in {@spell counterspell|Ishiir} and {@spell dispel magic|Ishiir}), you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: Starting at 14th level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells.
Furthermore, you have resistance against the damage of spells.

subclassFeature.name: Bladesinging
entries: Bladesingers master a tradition of wizardry that incorporates swordplay and dance. Originally created by elves, this tradition has been adopted by non-elf practitioners, who honor and expand on the elven ways.

In combat, a bladesinger uses a series of intricate, elegant maneuvers that fend off harm and allow the bladesinger to channel magic into devastating attacks and a cunning defense. Many who have observed a bladesinger at work remember the display as one of the more beautiful experiences in their life, a glorious dance accompanied by a singing blade.

subclassFeature.name: Bladesinger Styles
entries: From its inception as a martial and magical art, Bladesinging has been tied to the sword, more specifically the longsword. Yet many generations of study gave rise to various styles of Bladesinging based on the melee weapon employed. The techniques of these styles are passed from master to students in small schools, some of which have a building dedicated to instruction. Even the newest styles are hundreds of years old, but are still taught by their original creators due to the long lives of elves. Most schools of Bladesinging are in Evermeet or Evereska. One was started in Myth Drannor, but the city's destruction has scattered those students who survived.

Styles of Bladesinging are broadly categorized based on the type of weapon employed, and each is associated with a category of animal. Within that style are specializations named after specific animal types, based on the types of spells employed, the techniques of the master, and the particular weapon used. Bladesingers who apprentice to a master typically get a tattoo of their chosen style's animal. Some bladesingers learn multiple styles and bear many tattoos, wearing a warning on their skin of their deadly skills.

entries.name: Cat
entries: Styles that employ a sword belong to this family. The lion style, the eldest, trains practitioners in the use of the longsword and doesn't favor any particular type of spells. Leopard style focuses on the shortsword and spells of illusion and stealth. Red tiger, a style just three centuries old, has its bladesingers using the scimitar in a whirling dance of defense from which they launch into sudden leaps and attacks.

entries.name: Bird
entries: Styles that focus on the use of a hafted weapon, such as an axe or hammer, have been grouped together as bird styles, yet they vary wildly. All relatively new styles, they use weapons not typically favored by elves. Eagle-style bladesingers use small handaxes, and many maneuvers in the style focus on fluid ways to throw the weapon and draw a new one. Raven style uses a war pick, and spells associated with it grant the bladesinger more agility in combat.

entries.name: Snake
entries: Practitioners of these styles use a flail, chain, or whip. Viper style uses a whip, despite its inelegance as a weapon, and has almost as long a history as the lion style.
